r.d: A singly-linked list offers the ability to insert or delete nodes at any point within the list. A doubly-linked list also offers the ability to request previous nodes in the list.
r.n: * Adhere to CS (thanks PHP_CodeSniffer!) * Fix docblocks for Double vs. Single confusion * One change to API in that the protected method _getTailNode() has been renamed to getTailNode() per CS
